para: This option instructs the duplicate filter to remove any waypoint that has the same geographic coordinates as a waypoint that has already been processed. The comparison is done to a precision of six decimal places.
This is useful for cleaning up a single file with multiple points at the same location or for merging files where waypoints may not have matching names but are at identical locations.

example.title: Remove waypoints that are in the exact same location

para.userinput: gpsbabel -i gpx -f my_waypoints.gpx -x duplicate,location -o gpx -F cleaned.gpx
